intro: Acidosasa dayongensis, commonly known as the Yunnan acacia, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant features compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces yellow or pale green flowers. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in forested areas. Due to its ecological importance and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
